paragraphs.text:
%md
# About This Lab
**Objective:** Use the Spark SQL query to analyze data. Use the Catalog API to explor eHive tables, create DataFrames by executing SQL queries, and work with 
temporary views.
**Exercise Files**
    Exercise directory: /home/training/training_materials/devsh/exercises/spark-sql
    Data (local): /home/training/training_materials/devsh/data/accountdevice
    Hive table: devsh.accounts
**Successful outcome:**
**Before you begin:**
**Related lessons:** Querying Tables and Views with SQL

---

msg.data:
About This Lab

Objective: Use the Spark SQL query to analyze data. Use the Catalog API to explor eHive tables, create DataFrames by executing SQL queries, and work with
temporary views.
Exercise Files

Exercise directory: /home/training/training_materials/devsh/exercises/spark-sql
Data (local): /home/training/training_materials/devsh/data/accountdevice
Hive table: devsh.accounts

Successful outcome:
Before you begin:
Related lessons: Querying Tables and Views with SQL

%md
# Setup
---

paragraphs.title: Set the environment variable to manage thread count
paragraphs.text:
%sh

PYSPARK_PIN_THREAD=true

paragraphs.title: Start the Spark Context for Livy
paragraphs.text:
%pyspark

sc = spark.sparkContext

paragraphs.title: Clean up previous results by dropping the Hive table
paragraphs.text:
%sql

-- This ensures that the notebook runs without an error
--DROP TABLE IF EXISTS devsh.name_dev
SHOW TABLES

Result

You have now: used the Spark SQL API to analyze data

paragraphs.text:
%md
# Solution
---

msg.data: Solution

paragraphs.text:
%md
### Spark SQL
Spark SQL is a Spark module for structed data processing offering native support of SQL. It provides a programming abstraction called DataFrames upon which 
it builds a distributed SQL query engine. It meets the needs of many non-programmers, who are only familiar with SQL, to interact with Spark.

msg.data:
Spark SQL

Spark SQL is a Spark module for structed data processing offering native support of SQL. It provides a programming abstraction called DataFrames upon which
it builds a distributed SQL query engine. It meets the needs of many non-programmers, who are only familiar with SQL, to interact with Spark.

paragraphs.text:
%md
### Show Tables and Columns Using the Catalog API

msg.data: Show Tables and Columns Using the Catalog API

paragraphs.title: 1 - View the list of current Hive tables and temporary views in the devsh database

msg.data: Table(name=u'accounts', database=u'devsh', description=None, tableType=u'EXTERNAL', isTemporary=False)

paragraphs.text:
%md
#### Spark catalog functions
Spark `catalog` is the interface for managing a metastore of relational entities, such as databases, tables, columns, and views. It comes with a large number 
of methods, such as createTable, listTables, getTable, cacheTable, etc.

msg.data:
Spark catalog functions

Spark catalog is the interface for managing a metastore of relational entities, such as databases, tables, columns, and views. It comes with a large number
of methods, such as createTable, listTables, getTable, cacheTable, etc.

Column(name=u'city', description=None, dataType=u'string', nullable=True, isPartition=False, isBucket=False)
Column(name=u'state', description=None, dataType=u'string', nullable=True, isPartition=False, isBucket=False)
Column(name=u'zipcode', description=None, dataType=u'string', nullable=True, isPartition=False, isBucket=False)
Column(name=u'phone_number', description=None, dataType=u'string', nullable=True, isPartition=False, isBucket=False)

Column(name=u'modified', description=None, dataType=u'timestamp', nullable=True, isPartition=False, isBucket=False)

SHOW TABLES IN devsh

paragraphs.text:
%md
### Optional: 
Perform the equivalent query using the DataFrame API, and compare the schema and data in the results to those of the query above.

msg.data:
Optional:

Perform the equivalent query using the DataFrame API, and compare the schema and data in the results to those of the query above.

paragraphs.title: 7 - Perform the equivalent query using the Dataframe API
paragraphs.text:
%pyspark

sc.setJobGroup("Querying Tables and Views with SQL","Perform the equivalent query using the Dataframe API")
spark.read.table("devsh.accounts").select("first_name","last_name").show()

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

paragraphs.text:
%md
Create a DataFrame called accountDeviceDF based on the CSV files in /devsh_loudacre/accountdevice. (Be sure to use the headers and inferred schema to 
determine the column names and types.)

msg.data:
Create a DataFrame called accountDeviceDF based on the CSV files in /devsh_loudacre/accountdevice. (Be sure to use the headers and inferred schema to
determine the column names and types.)

paragraphs.title: 8 - Create a DataFrame called accountDeviceDF based on the CSV files in /devsh_loudacre/accountdevice
paragraphs.text:
%pyspark

sc.setJobGroup("Querying Tables and Views with SQL","Create a DataFrame called accountDeviceDF based on the CSV files in /devsh_loudacre/accountdevice")
accountDeviceDF = spark.read.option("header","true").option("inferSchema","true").csv("/devsh_loudacre/accountdevice")
accountDeviceDF.show()

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

paragraphs.title: 9 - Create a temporary view on the accountDeviceDF DataFrame called account_dev
paragraphs.text:
%pyspark

accountDeviceDF.createOrReplaceTempView("account_dev")

paragraphs.title: 10 - View the list of current Hive tables and temporary views in the devsh database
paragraphs.text:
%sql

SHOW TABLES IN devsh

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

msg.data:
database	tableName	isTemporary
devsh	accounts	false
	account_dev	true

paragraphs.text:
%md
Confirm the view was created correctly by listing the tables and views in the devsh database as you did earlier. Notice that the account_dev table type 
is TEMPORARY.

msg.data:
Confirm the view was created correctly by listing the tables and views in the devsh database as you did earlier. Notice that the account_dev table type
is TEMPORARY.

paragraphs.title: 11 - Select the 5 first rows of the account_dev view
paragraphs.text:
%sql

SELECT * FROM account_dev LIMIT 5

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

paragraphs.text:
%md
Using a SQL query, create a new DataFrame based on the first five rows of the account_dev view, and display the results.

msg.data: Using a SQL query, create a new DataFrame based on the first five rows of the account_dev view, and display the results.

paragraphs.text:
%md
### Use SQL to Join Two Tables

msg.data: Use SQL to Join Two Tables

paragraphs.title: 12 - Join the devsh.accounts table and account_dev view using the account ID, and display the results
paragraphs.text:
%sql

SELECT acct_num, first_name, last_name, account_device_id FROM devsh.accounts JOIN account_dev ON acct_num = account_id LIMIT 20

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

paragraphs.title: 13 - Save nameDevDF as a Hive table in the devsh called name_dev (with the file path as /devsh_loudacre/name_dev)
paragraphs.text:
%sql

CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS devsh.name_dev LOCATION "/devsh_loudacre/name_dev" AS SELECT acct_num, first_name, last_name, account_device_id FROM devsh.accounts JOIN account_dev ON acct_num = account_id

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

paragraphs.title: 14 - Confirm that the table has been created
paragraphs.text:
%sql

SHOW TABLES IN devsh

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

msg.data:
database	tableName	isTemporary
devsh	accounts	false
devsh	name_dev	false
	account_dev	true

paragraphs.text:
%md
# Tear Down
---

msg.data: Tear Down

paragraphs.title: Delete the Livy session
paragraphs.text:
%sh

sessionId=$(curl -s localhost:8998/sessions | jq '.sessions[0].id')
curl -s localhost:8998/sessions/$sessionId -X DELETE

msg.data: {"msg":"deleted"}

paragraphs.title: Additional resources
paragraphs.text:
%md
We hope you've enjoyed this lab. Below are additional resources that you should find useful:

1. [Cloudera Tutorials](http://cloudera.com/tutorials.html) are your natural next step where you can explore Spark in more depth.
2. [Cloudera Community](https://community.cloudera.com) is a great resource for questions and answers on Spark, Data Analytics/Science, and many more Big Data topics.
3. [Apache Spark Documentation](https://spark.apache.org/documentation.html) - official Spark documentation.
4. [Apache Zeppelin Project Home Page](https://zeppelin.apache.org) - official Zeppelin web site.

msg.data:
We hope you've enjoyed this lab. Below are additional resources that you should find useful:

  1. Cloudera Tutorials are your natural next step where you can explore Spark in more depth.
  2. Cloudera Community is a great resource for questions and answers on Spark, Data Analytics/Science, and many more Big Data topics.
  3. Apache Spark Documentation - official Spark documentation.
  4. Apache Zeppelin Project Home Page - official Zeppelin web site.
